availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Woods (Hamilton County, Ohio, paper dealer)

body.p: Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio paper dealer. Maryland native. Married to Elizabeth Woods. Father of Ella Woods, John S. Woods, Sally C. Woods, and Harry F. Woods. Paper dealer in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Ohio native John Cushman as a servant in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Ohio native Ellen Bemis as a seamstress in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed New York native Sarah Griffith as a servant in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Ohio native Louisa Hally as a servant in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Indiana native Mary Hally as a servant in Cincinnati in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 15, p. 392.
